related_issues.text:
Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)

## Issue Summary: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors

**Key Points:**

* User @SteveW555 reported an issue with the Chrome extension filling the developer console with errors.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
* Related issues and resources were provided by the Pieces support bot.
* @rutvik-at-pieces identified the issue as a duplicate of another reported problem.

**Problems Identified:**

* Chrome extension caused errors in the developer console.
* User experience may be impacted by the errors.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The issue was fixed in an upcoming release of the extension.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved and will be released within one or two days.
* The issue is a duplicate of another reported problem.

**Additional Notes:**

* The Chrome extension fills the developer console with errors.
* This issue will be fixed in the upcoming release of the extension.

**Improve communication with users experiencing the 'Pieces Plugin and Extension Errors'**: Provide updates on the progress of the fix and offer potential workarounds in the meantime. Proactive communication can help manage user expectations and reduce frustration.

**Analyze the root causes of 'bug' and 'os:windows' category tickets**: These are the most frequent categories, indicating potential areas for product improvement. Addressing underlying issues could prevent similar tickets in the future.

**Review and optimize support resources**: Ensure that resources provided by the support bot, such as related issues and documentation, are accurate, up-to-date, and helpful for users experiencing common issues like those with the Pieces plugin and extension.
